intro: Pilosella ferrea, commonly known as ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while its flowers range from white to purple, depending on the species. Pilosella ferrea is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
